title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Place Entity Documents
description: This document describes the structure and content of Place entity documents stored within the Getty MART Linked Data system. The Place entity documents follow the Place entity schema defined at https://linked.art/model/place/

citation.title: The Getty MART JSON Schema Documentation for Place Entity Documents

resourceInfo.abstract: The J. Paul Getty Trust is sharing Linked Data representations of its Collections data.

id.title: The Place Document's ID
id.description: This field contains the Place's ID, expressed as an absolute URL.

type.title: The Place Document's Type
type.description: This field contains the Place document's type, expressed as a string. It will always be 'Place' for Place entity documents.

_label.title: The Place Document's Developer-Friendly Label
_label.description: This field contains the document's developer-friendly label. This label is intended for reference purposes only as a development aid to provide a short human-readable summary of the contents of the current document or document fragment, and is not intended to be acted upon or displayed in any downstream system.
examples: Getty Center, Museum West Pavilion, Gallery W203

classified_as.title: The Place's classified_as Property
classified_as.description: This field contains classifications associated with the Place. These may include classifications related to the Place's type, and other classifiable attributes, etc.

identified_by.title: The Place's identified_by Property
identified_by.description: This field contains identifiers associated with the Place. These may include names used to refer to the Place, alternative document IDs, alternative names, etc.

part_of.title: The Place's part_of Property
part_of.description: This field contains information about the Place's hierarchy, whereby the system may provide additional partitioning information about the Place. This may include information about the Place's parent place, such as a city's parent region, a region's parent country, etc.

current_location.title: The Place's current_location Property
current_location.description: This field contains information about the Place's current location. For instance, if the Place describes a building, its current_location property can be used to describe the building's location.
